    def set_margin(self, margin: datatypes.MarginsType):
    """Set content margins for the widget.

    Arguments:
        margin: margins to use
    """
    self.setContentsMargins(datatypes.to_margins(margin))

    set_mask(area: datatypes.RectType | gui.QRegion | gui.QBitmap | None, typ: gui.region.RegionTypeStr = 'rectangle')

    Set mask of the widget.

    Parameters:

    Name Type Description Default
    area datatypes.RectType | gui.QRegion | gui.QBitmap | None

    Mask area

    		 required
    typ gui.region.RegionTypeStr

    type of region (only used if area is a QRegion)

    		 'rectangle'
    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    1093
1094
1095
1096
1097
1098
1099
1100
1101
1102
1103
1104
1105
1106
1107
1108
1109
1110
1111
1112
    def set_mask(
    self,
    area: datatypes.RectType | gui.QRegion | gui.QBitmap | None,
    typ: gui.region.RegionTypeStr = "rectangle",
):
    """Set mask of the widget.

    Arguments:
        area: Mask area
        typ: type of region (only used if area is a QRegion)
    """
    match area:
        case None:
            self.clearMask()
            return
        case (int(), int(), int(), int()):
            area = gui.Region(*area, gui.region.REGION_TYPE[typ])
        case core.QRect():
            area = gui.Region(area, gui.region.REGION_TYPE[typ])
    self.setMask(area)

    set_modality(modality: constants.WindowModalityStr | constants.WindowModality)

    set_size_policy(horizontal: widgets.sizepolicy.SizePolicyStr | widgets.QSizePolicy.Policy | None = None, vertical: widgets.sizepolicy.SizePolicyStr | widgets.QSizePolicy.Policy | None = None)

    Set the size policy.

    Parameters:

    Name Type Description Default
    horizontal widgets.sizepolicy.SizePolicyStr | widgets.QSizePolicy.Policy | None

    horizontal size policy

    		 None
    vertical widgets.sizepolicy.SizePolicyStr | widgets.QSizePolicy.Policy | None

    vertical size policy

    		 None
    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    699
700
701
702
703
704
705
706
707
708
709
710
711
712
713
714
715
716
717
718
719
    def set_size_policy(
    self,
    horizontal: widgets.sizepolicy.SizePolicyStr
    | widgets.QSizePolicy.Policy
    | None = None,
    vertical: widgets.sizepolicy.SizePolicyStr
    | widgets.QSizePolicy.Policy
    | None = None,
):
    """Set the size policy.

    Args:
        horizontal: horizontal size policy
        vertical: vertical size policy
    """
    sp = self.get_size_policy()
    if horizontal is not None:
        sp.set_horizontal_policy(horizontal)
    if vertical is not None:
        sp.set_vertical_policy(vertical)
    self.setSizePolicy(sp)

    set_style(style: str | widgets.QStyle)

    Set widget style.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    1153
1154
1155
1156
1157
    def set_style(self, style: str | widgets.QStyle):
    """Set widget style."""
    if isinstance(style, str):
        style = widgets.QStyleFactory.create(style)
    self.setStyle(style)

    set_stylesheet(ss: None | str | qstylizer.style.StyleSheet | datatypes.PathType)

    Set stylesheet for this widget.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    770
771
772
773
774
775
776
777
778
779
780
781
782
783
    def set_stylesheet(
    self, ss: None | str | qstylizer.style.StyleSheet | datatypes.PathType
):
    """Set stylesheet for this widget."""
    match ss:
        case None:
            ss = ""
        case str():
            pass
        case os.PathLike():
            ss = pathlib.Path(ss).read_text()
        case qstylizer.style.StyleSheet():
            ss = str(ss)
    self.setStyleSheet(ss)

    set_tooltip(tooltip: str | datatypes.PathType, size: datatypes.SizeType | None = None, rich_text: bool = False)

    Set a tooltip for this widget.

    In image can get displayed by passing a PathLike object.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    380
381
382
383
384
385
386
387
388
389
390
391
392
393
394
395
396
397
398
399
400
401
    def set_tooltip(
    self,
    tooltip: str | datatypes.PathType,
    size: datatypes.SizeType | None = None,
    rich_text: bool = False,
):
    """Set a tooltip for this widget.

    In image can get displayed by passing a PathLike object.
    """
    if isinstance(tooltip, os.PathLike):
        path = os.fspath(tooltip)
        if size is None:
            tooltip = f"<img src={path!r}>"
        else:
            if isinstance(size, core.QSize):
                size = (size.width(), size.height())
            tooltip = f'<img src={path!r} width="{size[0]}" height="{size[1]}">'
    tooltip = tooltip.replace("\n", "<br/>")
    if rich_text:
        tooltip = f"<html>{html.escape(tooltip)}</html>"
    super().setToolTip(tooltip)

    set_window_state(state: constants.WindowStateStr | constants.WindowState)

    Set window state for given item view.

    Parameters:

    Name Type Description Default
    state constants.WindowStateStr | constants.WindowState

    window state to use

    		 required
    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    824

829
830
    def set_window_state(self, state: constants.WindowStateStr | constants.WindowState):
    """Set window state for given item view.

    Args:
        state: window state to use
    """
    self.setWindowState(constants.WINDOW_STATES.get_enum_value(state))

    show_tooltip(duration: int | None = None)

    Show the tooltip of this widget for given time.

    When no duration is given, it will get calculated based on length.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    293
294
295
296
297
298
299
300
301
    def show_tooltip(self, duration: int | None = None):
    """Show the tooltip of this widget for given time.

    When no duration is given, it will get calculated based on length.
    """
    if duration is None:
        duration = -1  # automatic
    pos = self.map_to("global", (0, 0))
    widgets.ToolTip.showText(pos, self.toolTip(), msecShowTime=duration)

    toggle_fullscreen() -> bool

    Toggle between fullscreen and regular size.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    144
145
146
147
148
149
150
151
    def toggle_fullscreen(self) -> bool:
    """Toggle between fullscreen and regular size."""
    if self.isFullScreen():
        self.showNormal()
        return False
    else:
        self.showFullScreen()
        return True

    toggle_maximized() -> bool

    Toggle between maximized and regular size.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    153
154
155
156
157
158
159
160
    def toggle_maximized(self) -> bool:
    """Toggle between maximized and regular size."""
    if self.isMaximized():
        self.showNormal()
        return False
    else:
        self.showMaximized()
        return True

    updates_off() -> Iterator[None]

    Context manager to turn off updates for this widget.

    Source code in prettyqt\widgets\widget.py 
    755
756
757
758
759
760
761
    @contextlib.contextmanager
def updates_off(self) -> Iterator[None]:
    """Context manager to turn off updates for this widget."""
    updates = self.updatesEnabled()
    self.setUpdatesEnabled(False)
    yield None
    self.setUpdatesEnabled(updates)
